Review: I switched to Nespresso simply because they have the best single cup coffees available, and the three included in this package are among my favorites. The only negatives to Nespresso coffees, in general, are price and availability. The Nespresso capsules are considerably more expensive than any of their competitor's products. Additionally, since they recently closed our only local Nespresso Boutique, I am relegated to buying the capsules online. The ability to purchase the capsules is a great convenience because they arrive much quicker than if purchased directly through Nespresso, and the prices are the same. The only things lacking from Amazon are the variety of coffees, free gifts included in direct purchases, and the lack of recycle bags for used Nespresso capsules. I have received recycle bags in two of the packages I purchased from Amazon, but this is not nearly enough. I wish Amazon would include a recycle bag in each box of capsules.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2020년 1월 30일

Review: The people giving this machine negative reviews and saying a Keurig is better… I actually laughed out loud. This machine is 3,000 times better than any Keurig I’ve owned and I have had several. Yes, the coffee does not get scorching hot, but that’s a huge benefit in my mind. The coffee brews in less than 30 seconds and then is drinkable without burning your mouth immediately. The pods may be more expensive, but you get what you pay for. Their flavors are top notch, and truly taste as good or better than any coffee you can get in a coffee shop. I don’t see myself stopping at Starbucks anytime in the future. I can now make incredible coffee at home. Ten stars.

We love it and talk about value for the money? I’d say that at $5.00 a cup at Starbucks vs. a little over a dollar for a cup at home is pretty cool. Our Keurig will be sitting in the garage as a backup. My only complaint would be the water reservoir is not as large as I’d like but it’s still easy enough to refill. Review:
Price over convenience. For a heavy coffee or espresso drinker a mug is $3 or more. May as well go out and have someone serve you.
If you sip I suppose it's ok. But the price per capsule is just over $1. Got money to burn it's not an issue.
Aside from the convenient capsule and cool machine before you buy and end up returning do the math. A 12 cup pot of coffee made at home comes in at under $1 per pot. 12 cups of this is $13 and you need 2 boxes. Per month I would go through 1 pot of coffe per day. That's about $33 a month for coffee and filters. If you used 12 capsules a day you would pay over $390 a month in espresso capsules. Do your math first.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2020년 1월 30일

Review: It’s do-your-own-coffee these days, so better make it as good as you can. Nespresso does that, and the pods are recyclable which I love. Easy to use, the machine tosses the old one into a compartment when you go to add a new pod. Clear out the old pods once a week and take them to a Nespresso store (or maybe recycle on line?? Not sure.) I choose the darkest roast coffee which is strong and bitter, but there are a variety of mellower kinds to pick from. And Amazon Prime gets my replacements here so fast, I don’t have to panic when I am running low.

The capsules arrived fine, my favorites are the Melozio and the Odacio (the Stormio is the strongest but not my cup of tea--er, coffee). I live in New York City so it's not hard to find somewhere that sells the Nespresso, but it's also not incredibly convenient. The Nespresso Vertuoline Best Seller Assortment is perfect for when I want to sip a full cup of coffee and not just have a shot of espresso. The flavors provided are seperate and unique, not just different color capsules for what ends tasting like the same coffee as other brands I have tried have.

Nespresso has been in the capsule coffee business long enough to have a variety of terrific flavors. They know what they are doing and they do it well.

My only complaint and reason for only four stars is the price. At almost a dollar a cup, there are other options that check the quick coffee/espresso box with a better price to quality ratio.

Review: Save your capsules and reuse them. Any chance possible I love to poke my fingers in big corporations eyes. with all other coffee makers people have found a way to give you cheaper versions of the coffee pods or allow you to create your own. Nespresso spent who knows how much money trying to engineer capsules that could not be re used but it probably took 30 minutes for someone smart to figure out how to re-use these. Search google/amazon and you will find many kits with aluminum labels that you can use your own coffee to make your own pods. I bought 3 or 4 boxes of these and saved all the aluminum pods removing the old top. you can buy mycaps, recaps or 3 other vendors who sell cheap aluminum foil tops. ... every 2-3 weeks i refill 50-60 pods and it takes me 45 seconds per pod. I save $1000 a year easy and my coffee is 10X better than theirs.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2021년 9월 26일

Otherwise, Nespresso Vertuo coffee pods are amazing in taste and super easy to use. As for Nespresso, I wish they would allow third-party brands to make Vertuo pods like they allow for the classic pods, but of course, this would drive down prices because of competition, which they don't want.

Review:
As other reviews have suggested, these are counterfeit. Let me count the ways that are obvious.

Things that are wrong
-no blend name on foil seal
-strange colors on basic pods
-pours that do not match the actual pod size(copied bar code from another pod)
-real pods have better airseal. These are like a deflated baloon.

God knows what is in these pods.

Review:
This Nespresso “best seller” selection has three different intensity coffee capsules for VertuoLine machines only. This includes 10 each of Stormio (intensity 8), Odacio (intensity 7) and Melozio (6 intensity) that brew larger 7.8 oz cups of coffee rather than the short espresso shots. It’s a good assortment of coffee that’s all rich and flavorful but varies in intensity.

Stormio is a bold, dark roast coffee that’s rich and flavorful. It tastes like a good French Roast that’s strong and rich enough to make a satisfying Café Au Lait (coffee with hot milk) that’s a little smoky but not charred or burnt tasting. Stormio is a pleasing medium bodied coffee with thick foam from the brewing process. It’s lightly acidic and a touch bitter in an enjoyable way. I enjoy Stormio a lot. 5 stars.

Odacio is a blend of light roasted Ethiopian beans and long roasted Nicaraguan beans. It’s rather dark and bold, but also lively. It has a full bodied mouthfeel as it’s thick and creamy. It’s flavorful with cereal notes and lighter fruity notes. This coffee doesn’t taste sweet like my favorite dark roasts that have chocolate or caramel notes, but milk and sugar bring out some sweetness and Odacio is robust and satisfying. 4.5 stars.

Melozio is more of a medium roast that tastes rich and flavorful but still mellow. It’s not too weak or too intense. I’d describe it as medium bodied as it’s not watery or thin. It’s a smooth and balanced coffee that I prefer with milk and sugar to bring out the flavor and sweeter notes, though I drink all my coffee with milk and sugar (or other sweetener). Being less intense, Melozio is a pleasant surprise as I thought it might be too weak for me. 5 stars. Overall, an enjoyable assortment of quality coffee capsules. 5 stars.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 4월 6일

Review:
I'm one of those dudes that can't start my day without my daily cup of joe, especially that first cup in the morning. Instant freeze dried coffee can be economical, convenient and time saving, but they lack taste when compared to freshly brewed counterparts. When it comes to brewed coffee, this is typically accomplished by traditional drip coffemakers w/ carafe or Keurig-style drip coffee via coffee pods. One of the latest & most popular & high-end homebrew coffeemaker is the Nespresso lines of coffee machines, and its myriad of Nespresso coffee pods. If you own one of these machines, typically you'd need a milk Frother as well to make best possible Nespresso style espresso drinks, the challenge isn't how to make it, but with so many varieties and flavors available, WHICH one to choose!

Through Amazon's Vine Voices Program, this problem, albeit it a good one, is easily solved, when I discovered the 『Nespresso Capsules VertuoLine, Best Seller Variety Pack』.

The VERDICT
==========
Every Espresso machine owner knows that it can be difficult to search through the variety of VertuoLine pods and capsules. This is one of the nicest things about the Nespresso world – the many choices. But this wide range of products is, of course, also quite confusing.

This Nespresso Capsules VertuoLine contains the entire Nespresso VertuoLine assorted coffee pods from Stormio (10), Odacio (10) & Melozio (10), this is same as strong, medium to light roast. So, my family & I, everyone can have a Nespresso espresso drink with the preferred brewing strength. Absolutely perfectly blend of different strengths, you bound to find one you enjoy.

💞🤩🤩💕☕👍☕ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED☕👍☕💞🤩🥰💕
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 3월 1일

Review:
This is the classic coffee lovers variety pack. It's the first selection I bought when I had used up the few pods that came with my machine, and I continued to buy it until I started dabbling in the single origin pods.

If you're buying this as a gift for someone else, and you don't know what they like, get them this. All three flavors in here are great. Stomio is the strongest, Melozio is the mildest, and Odacio is in between. But all three of them taste bold and engaging to me. Personally, I like to have the Odacio in the morning and a Stormio after lunch. My wife likes the Melozio, so those are for her.

You can either buy your Vertuoline pods from the Nespresso website, or from here. (Or the Nespresso Store if you are lucky enough to live near one). The advantage of the Nespresso website is more selection, including seasonal and single origin flavors. The advantage of Amazon is free delivery even for small orders for Prime members, and overnight delivery in many markets.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 5월 31일

Review:
This medium to dark roast variety pack of coffees is impressive. The numbers corresponding to the strength on the coffees' strength is very accurate to me. The flavors are very rich and deep, with a delightful aroma that fills the kitchen while they are brewing. The darkest one, Stormio, reminds me a bit of some Cuban coffee I had years ago. I had to sip on that one, because it was much stronger than what I'm used to. However, it was good, but it's not a flavor I would drink daily because it is so dark and strong and for me, one to be sipped and savored.

The other two flavors were easier to enjoy, because the strengths and darkness were more familiar to me. I enjoyed trying to discern the different "notes" in each. The quality of all 3 flavors felt very high-end to me, much nicer than the typical coffees that I drink daily on a regular basis.

Comparing the quality and flavor of the Nespresso to the other major competing brand, the Nespresso wins hands-down in my opinion. However, it's also more costly than that brand, so that's a definite consideration for me. For those who go out and buy their coffee at coffee shops and are wanting the same (or better) quality and flavor of coffee at home, this is a definite cost-effective and richly flavorful option to consider. Thanks for reading.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2020년 1월 30일

Review:
These Nespresso Vertuoline Capsules have a nice variety of bolder flavors that are flavorful and a treat to drink. While I like more mediumish roasts in general for every day coffee, these are on the upper end of the medium lines and into the bolder, darker ones - but they aren't too bitter or too overpowering, either. They have a great flavor, and I honestly can't figure out which one is my favorite.

They all make a lovely crema in our Nespresso Vertuoline machine, and we love the richer flavors that make us feel like we have our own personal gourmet coffee barista ready to serve up the most delectable Nespresso whenever we want. I like this set, because it's a happy medium between my husband and I - he likes the darker roasts, and I am more into the medium ones, and these are kinda on those fence lines that satisfy us both, no matter which one we choose out of the 3 in this variety pack. It gets two thumbs up from us - YUM!
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 2월 18일

Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2017년 9월 18일

Review:
You have to buy the Nespresso coffee machine to brew these pods properly, so you probably already know how much your cup of coffee costs.

I like that the flavors are always consistently good. There are a lot of different flavors to try if you like experimenting. I like their intensity scale so I don't have to guess too much about what a new flavor will taste like.

The product description makes a big point about the used pods being recyclable (unlike the disposable Keurig pods). However, you cannot recycle the pods through most city home recycling systems. You need to send the pods back to Nespresso. If you buy the pods directly from Nespresso, they will give you a postage-paid package for you to send the used pods back. Unfortunately, you do not get the recycling package when you buy from Amazon. Minus one star because recycling is a hoax for Amazon customers.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2018년 8월 7일

Review:
My daughter got a Nespresso Machine for Christmas so when I saw these variety packs I knew I had to get them for her. These are high ticket but worth every penny.

The pods are easy to use in your machine following the instructions for your Nespresso brewer. I love that this includes three different flavors 10 Stormio, 10 Odacio, and 10 Melozio. Each box gives a meter to let you know the intensity of the flavor.

Besides being great coffee the pods are aluminum and you can take them apart, dispose of the coffee and recycle the pods.

These are name brand and came in perfect order. I read a few reviews saying pods were damaged but these came with the three box inside the manufacturers box so there really is no way for them to be damaged.

Thanks for reading my review

Becky Brooks
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2017년 8월 14일

Review:
I've had all of these flavor pods in the past and liked them so I thought the variety pack would be great. For some reason with this batch I found I wasn't really enjoying the Melozio compared to the Odacio and Stormio. And between the Odacio and Stormio, I enjoyed the Stormio a little better. Felt the flavor was less muddy than the others.

Overall, I find the Nespresso Vertuoline to be excellent coffees especially when compared to the original Nespresso pods that I would make as Americano. The packaging has changed recently to just dumping the pods into the boxes versus putting them in special sleeves (which were a slight pain to remove the pods from). The pods packaged this way arrived just fine, no damage or denting.

Overall, great coffees.. try them out in something like this variety pack to figure out your preference.

I hope this helps you.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 2월 1일

Review:
For use with only Nespresso’s VertuoLine machines, this set of three medium and dark roast best sellers is close to perfect and it includes Melozio has an intensity of 6, Odacio is A 7 and Stormio is level 8. Each have their own taste characteristics—Melozio is very smooth, Odacio is slightly more acidic so brighter and somewhat bolder and Stormio which is dark, rich and bold.

All three brew a 7.77 ounce cup with the usual generous layer of crema. The aluminum pods are recyclable and do not impart any odd flavors unlike some of the plastic pods used with single cup brewers. There is a reason these three varieties are best sellers. Excellent.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 3월 26일

Review: Great tasting coffee quite pricey when bought alone. I did get it as part of a deal. We do reuse the pot a few x granted the consecutive coffee aren't as potent as the first and we need to be careful that the seal shouldn't get completely cut off but for light coffee it's great. I let the real coffee lover have the first and I have the next. The taste is potent enough at least for me it is.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 3월 27일

Review:
The collection of capsules in this variety pack is not coffee you drink, rather these brews are to be sipped and savored like a fine wine.
Odacio is a Nicaraguan Arabica with cereal note, a splash of acidity, and a delicate fruitiness.
Stormio is a highly roasted blend of Nicaraguan and Guatemalan coffee beans with spicy, woody notes and a hint of cayenne. It has a smooth richness and was my favorite of the three. I drank a cup of my regular brew afterward and it was tasteless.
Melozio is a blend of Brazilian bourbon and Central American Arabicas that is lightly roasted for a smooth, perfectly balanced coffee.
I enjoyed all three blends. They are all quality coffees that are well worth the price. They would make an excellent gift for your favorite coffee drinker, especially if you gave them the brewer, too.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2018년 8월 7일

Review:
You likely know that these are for VertuoLine machines and not OriginalLine, though it's worth noting first, just in case.

Fantastic! All of them for sure- though Stormio is hands down a favorite for me. With flavor and intensity- definitely gives the kick I'm looking for in the morning.

I'm the person that drinks too much caffeine so I often take a steel mug with me to work and it's still great later in the day.(mainly have used the Melozio for this). I don't have the urge to pick up coffee while out, when having it with me.

Love everything about these, even the packaging somehow adds to making it great 😄🤔

Review: Nespresso rules when it comes to pod coffee. The flavors are much better than Keurig pods, and Nespresso provides free sleeves to return used pods for recycling, so no guilt necessary. If you want a good introduction to Nespresso's coffees, this three-pack is a great way to go. Odacio is a cerealy blend, a plain and solid cup; Melozio is more flavorful; and Stormio is a strong blend that will put hair on your chest and will definitely wake you up in the morning. Each provides a good froth and a full cup, and is fine with or without cream and sugar, though the cream brings out more subtle flavors. We *always* have Nespresso Vertuoline pods in the kitchen, and these are three fine ways to enjoy the varied flavors. Highly recommended!

Review:
Nespresso is hands down the best at-home, single-serve, quick cup of coffee. We have had our Nespresso for a couple of years. I only use it occasionally, but my husband uses it almost daily for espresso. I enjoy a larger and weaker cup of coffee.

This is the best variety pack for the coffee drinkers at our house! My husband's favorite is the Stormio because he prefers a dark roast. My favorite is Melozio because I prefer a medium roast. The odocio is also a good flavor but is not as good as Stormio!

The price for these is much better on Amazon than at other retailers too!

Review:
Would buy these again as the quality of the coffee is simply the best for at a relatively inexpensive home machine like this.

Three different flavors are essentially, light, medium and dark and all are really good, and I think the choices for favorites are all contingent on whether you like a lighter or stronger coffee flavor. These are so good, they don't even need sugar (less calories when having your coffee, which is a plus in my book.)

Easy to order, use and recycle, which is very important to me as I wouldn't use these if they were not ecologically friendly.

Would definitely recommend. Love having these delivered to my door, especially now.

Review:
Honestly now that I'm tasting gas station coffee in my mind's mouth, that does a disservice to the coffees I've pounded down on long road trips.

Every single flavor/roast/fake italian word of these is absolutely vile.

We found a vertuo machine on the street (first warning, maybe you're smarter than we are), and bought some sleeves of these capsules. We've had regular nespresso and they're not great but they're fun and we have a baby coming. We figured this would be the same. Well joke's on us, because these coffees are so undrinkable we are opting to hang out with our screaming two week old and wait for our good old Mr Coffee to perk up instead of drinking these weirdly foamy, absolutely tooth-shatteringly awful cups of coffee. 0/10 avoid like the plague.

I guess I'd rate these "giftable" because I recommend you giving them away as soon as they arrive.

Review:
Having owned Nespresso machines both the original line and Venturo line for several years now I feel I’m qualified to give accurate and objective reviews of these products. I do not enjoy or drink flavored coffee so I only order regular coffee never decaf. I tend to favor the dark roast coffees so that is what I always order.

The coffee in Nespresso pods are all high quality and expertly roasted! When I got my first Nespresso machine an original line unit I did try a few of the other brands but none of the knock off brands came close to the taste and quality of the Nespresso product. Even though I could save a few bucks using the knock off pods I came to the conclusion that using the Nespresso brand pods was cheaper than going to Brand “S” to get my coffee fix. Plus it was better for the environment since Nespresso has a recycling plan for its own pods which is easy to participate in unlike the knock off brands which are usually plastic thus not easy to recycle. With the Venturo machine there is no decision to be made the only pods that will work are made by Nespresso. Yes they cost a bit more than those for original line machines, but the brew they make is top quality!
So, if like myself you enjoy good well made coffee I believe the investment in a Venturo machine is worth every penny spent!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2018년 5월 13일

Review:
These pods are well worth the money. At only ~$1/pod, they may sound expensive, but compared to what I would spend on a latte at Starbucks-- it's a steal!

Taste: very flavorful. This variety pack is perfect for my husband and I. He likes a strong coffee, I like a medium coffee. This pack is the best of both worlds.

Value: being a previous Keurig lover, I was a little thrown off by the price of the pods when we got the Nespresso machine as a gift. But, the quality of the pods far exceeds the quality of the Keurig pods. Point blank, you get what you pay for. And considering the quality of this product, the value is a steal.

Definitely recommend this variety pack, definitely will be buying again in the future.
Date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on 2019년 10월 8일
